titleStmt.title: A godlie and learned exposition upon the whole epistle of Iude, containing threescore and sixe sermons preached in Cambridge by that reverend and faithfull man of God, Master William Perkins, and now at the request of his executors, published by Thomas Taylor, preacher of Gods word ; whereunto is prefixed a large analysis, containing the summe and order of the whole booke, according to the authors owne method, to which are further added, foure briefe tables to direct the reader ...
titleStmt.author: Perkins, William, 1558-1602.

titleStmt.title: A godlie and learned exposition upon the whole epistle of Iude, containing threescore and sixe sermons preached in Cambridge by that reverend and faithfull man of God, Master William Perkins, and now at the request of his executors, published by Thomas Taylor, preacher of Gods word ; whereunto is prefixed a large analysis, containing the summe and order of the whole booke, according to the authors owne method, to which are further added, foure briefe tables to direct the reader ...
titleStmt.author: Perkins, William, 1558-1602.
Taylor, Thomas.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Felix Kyngston for Thomas Man, dwelling in Pater noster row, at the signe of the Talbot,

notesStmt.note: Errors in paging: pages 41-47 numbered 31-37; pages 58-59 lacking in number only.
Identified as STC 19724 on reel 1181, and as STC 19724 (part of STC 19648) on reel 1492.
Reproduction of originals in: British Library.
